title: poster crit
content:
Hi everyone,  
I've been working on this poster, I've fiddling around with it so much, and have come up with something pretty unsatisfactory.  
I can't see where else to go with it at the moment, and was hoping for a bit of guidance.

Its an A3 poster, aimed at people interested in all sorts of design.  
I wanted to achieve a stylish, typographic layout, but could do with a little help, after looking at it for too long! Theres a lot of content to shoehorn in.

Many thanks

Toby

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420022736im_/http:/typophile.com/files/poster_3942.jpg)
author: toby1

comments.content:
My first thought would be that it needs to be a lot simpler. Less clutter would allow for the typography to speak for itself.  
Also it may be me but i am not a fan of the cap A.

Will

Looks little cluttered to me too.

The photo makes it looks a little heavy at the top left with it bleeding.  
In keeping with the typographic layout concept, maybe?:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420022736im_/http:/typophile.com/files/poster_3942r_6717.jpg)

Something is distracting about the colon after 'SHIPLEY LATES:' to me...
is the photo necessary? i guess the colon looks like it wanted to be centered veritcally.
